citation.excerpt: machine. Use batch-size=1 on CPU and batch-size>1 on GPUs.

description.excerpt: For academic researchers, whether seeking to improve fawkes or to explore potential vunerability, please refer to the
Fawkes, privacy preserving tool against facial recognition systems. More info at https://sandlab.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes

installation.excerpt:
Run on GPU. The current Fawkes package and binary does not support GPU. To use GPU, you need to clone this repo, install 
  the required packages in setup.py, and replace tensorflow with tensorflow-gpu. Then you can run Fawkes
We are actively working on this. Python scripts that can test the protection effectiveness will be ready shortly.

Install from PyPI: 
pip install fawkes 
If you don't have root privilege, please try to install on user namespace: pip install --user fawkes.

excerpt.body:
Stable release of Fawkes source code. This version has an major updated on target selection algorithm that significantly reduces the likelihood of perturbation artifacts after cloaking. If you downloaded and experimented with v0.2 or v0.1, we strongly suggest you try v0.3. For more details of what Fawkes do, checkout our [webpage](https://sandlab.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes). 

We release on software in other format. [mac .dmg](https://sandlab.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes/files/Fawkes-0.3.dmg), [windows .exe](https://sandlab.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes/files/Fawkes-0.3.exe), [mac binary](https://mirror.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes/files/fawkes_binary_mac-v0.3.zip), [windows binary](https://mirror.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes/files/fawkes_binary_windows-v0.3.zip), [linux binary](https://mirror.cs.uchicago.edu/fawkes/files/fawkes_binary_linux-v0.3.zip), [Pypi package](https://pypi.org/project/fawkes/).
excerpt.name: Fawkes 0.3
